heading: the gop race
subheading: missouri senator john ashcroft, once the darling of the christian right, will stay out of the race for the republican presidential nomination. ashcroft decided against the long-shot bid in the face of a strong challenge to retain his senate seat in 2000 from popular democratic governor mel carnahan -- a challenge that is pushing him toward the center of the political spectrum, to the dismay of conservatives.
author: wired staff
text: missouri senator john ashcroft, once the darling of the christian right, will stay out of the race for the republican presidential nomination. ashcroft decided against the long-shot bid in the face of a strong challenge to retain his senate seat in 2000 from popular democratic governor mel carnahan -- a challenge that is pushing him toward the center of the political spectrum, to the dismay of conservatives.
